editorialSummary.text: Informal rooms in a relaxed hotel offering a fitness room, plus complimentary breakfast & Wi-Fi.

text.text: I had a fantastic experience at this hotel! The room was clean, spacious, and well-maintained. The staff were incredibly courteous and always ready to help with a smile. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of fresh options, and the pool area was relaxing. Special thanks to Sharan for making check-in and check-out so smooth.

originalText.text: I had a fantastic experience at this hotel! The room was clean, spacious, and well-maintained. The staff were incredibly courteous and always ready to help with a smile. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of fresh options, and the pool area was relaxing. Special thanks to Sharan for making check-in and check-out so smooth.

text.text:
Visited for lunch
I recently had a mixed dining experience at Holiday Inn Express. It started off with the masala peanuts — the portion was quite generous, but there was way too much lemon squeezed in, which overpowered the taste. I returned it, and thankfully, the second serving was much better and more balanced.

We also tried the burger and sandwich — both came with fries. The food was decent, nothing extraordinary, but the serving time was a bit slow, which took away from the overall experience.

The highlight, surprisingly, was the dessert. The vanilla chocolate brownie was really good — rich, warm, and satisfying.

Overall, the food was okay, service could be quicker, but they were responsive to feedback, which I appreciate

text.text:
I recently stayed at Holiday Inn Whitefield and had a comfortable and pleasant experience overall. The rooms were neat, clean, and well-maintained, but are small in size, no wardrobe, no hooks in bathroom (where to keep bathroom towel, clothes!!!) hence this aspect needs improvement.

Housekeeping did a great job in ensuring the room was tidy every day.

The hotel facilities are quite good — from the well-equipped gym to the lounge and self laundary areas, everything was clean and functional. The location is also a big plus. It’s conveniently situated near the main road and bus stop, which made getting around Bangalore much easier.

The in-house restaurant served a decent variety of dishes. While the food is taste okay, the service was courteous. The breakfast spread was decent, I feel could have some more or some other variety, I found it limited and no LIVE dosa counter, only omlette available from live kitchen...

The front desk staff were polite and check-in/check-out was smooth and hassle-free. I also appreciated the security and overall cleanliness of the property.

editorialSummary.text: Casual rooms & suites with a/c in a relaxed hotel with a restaurant, free parking & event space.

text.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 days. While the room itself was decent in terms of size and layout, there were several issues that affected the overall experience. There was a strong smell of cigarette smoke throughout my stay, and unfortunately, I also found a used cigarette in the room when I arrived.

The kettle was not clean and had an unpleasant odor, and the bedsheets and bathroom could have been much cleaner. I noticed some hair in the bathroom and also saw a few bugs, including cockroaches, which was concerning.

I did inform the reception about the smell and requested a room freshener spray, but despite assurances, nothing was done.

With some attention to cleanliness and better responsiveness from staff, the stay could have been much more comfortable.

We booked a double room for 2 nights from 15th Of August to 17th of August (checking out) at this Octave Hotel property at Double Road.
Lets start from the reception....no proper receptionist at the counter. He did not allow us first saying we have not booked
any rooms, which was not right. We had to  keep insisting to speak to someone responsible.After about 45 mins.of waiting and arguing we were shown several rooms on the 4th floor.The only thing working was the lift .Payment has to be made at the counter before checking in, then we were shown rooms to decide which one  although we were given a voucher saying super deluxe room with breakfast.
Please do not ever make this mistake of booking at this hotel.The rooms( most of the door lock broken) in the 4th floor where they were showing us to choose which room to give us,in all the rooms the TV  was not working, the bed sheets were not washed, the floor was full of small size cockroaches and the entire room smelt very bad, asked for room freshner, they did not have one.
The bathroom had a wash basin which was totally full of filth and once the tap was on instead of water flowing down the pipe everything with a lot of dirt and food particles came up and the whole basin was full. The Geyser hung there was not working.And many types of insects full on the floor. A bucket without a mug was under the tap, asked for a mug no answer, to contact reception every time you have to go down to the ground floor. We had a booking with breakfast ( CP Plan) but the man at the reception said we do not have any sort of kitchen how to provide breakfast. Again speak over the phone God knows who he was said we will send some packet food next morning , we rejected seeing their standard. No water bottles provided in the rooms.Near the lift one mineral water 20lts.was on a dispenser covered with a piece of cloth.On removing the cloth found a very dirty bottle half full on the dispenser not at all suitable for washing hands and foot. The photo of the lounge and reception seen on line of this property with the address is not of this place.
The reception has a small table with a computer but no receptionist as we call a labour sort of person who does not any idea about anything.
Very very poor idea. We ordered some food as it was already late we checked in The man who came to deliver food pushed the door hard and the whole door fell as the lock with the frame came out broken.Again we shifted to another room 408.The delivery boy said in Hindi ye hotel aisai hai.

text.text:
I booked this hotel for 11 days with breakfast and dinner included..   my review about this hotel:

The hotel is in a very good location.
Rooms are clean and comfortable
Staffs are friendly..

but for information about breakfast and dinner:
There is no in-house restaurant. Instead, the hotel provides two food tokens per day—one for breakfast and one for dinner—which must be redeemed at  third-party eatery across the main road. This eatery is open to the public and only serves a limited South Indian menu (idli, dosa, vada, or puri). Each token gives you a very small portion—for example, on the first day, I was served just two pieces of vada for dinner. The portion sizes are more suitable for a small child than an adult.

overall : The hotel is good in terms of location, rooms, and staff, but the food service is definitely an area that needs significant improvement.

text.text:
Exceptional Customer Service at [Quality comfort]

During my recent stay at [Quality comfort,] I was thoroughly impressed by the outstanding customer care provided by the staff. From the moment I arrived, the front desk team greeted me warmly, making the check-in process swift and pleasant. They were attentive to my needs and ensured that all my questions were answered with patience and professionalism.

What stood out the most was the staff's proactive approach to service. They anticipated my needs, offering assistance before I even had to ask. For instance, when I inquired about local dining options, they not only provided a list of nearby restaurants but also offered personal recommendations based on my preferences.

The housekeeping team maintained the room impeccably, and any requests for additional amenities were met promptly. Their commitment to cleanliness and guest comfort was evident throughout my stay.

Overall, the exceptional customer service at [Quality comfort,] made my stay memorable and enjoyable. I highly recommend this motel to anyone seeking a comfortable stay with top-notch hospitality.

text.text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at Hotel City Centaur, and overall, it proved to be a comfortable and convenient choice for my visit.

The hotel's location in the heart of the city was a major plus, providing easy access to key attractions, shopping areas, and transportation hubs. This central placement made it convenient for both business and leisure activities, allowing me to explore the city with ease.

The check-in process was efficient, and the staff at the front desk were friendly and accommodating. The room I stayed in was clean and well-maintained, offering a comfortable space for relaxation. While the decor may be more on the functional side than luxurious, it served its purpose well for a practical stay.

The amenities at Hotel City Centaur were satisfactory. The on-site restaurant offered a decent selection of dishes, and the breakfast buffet provided a good start to the day. The hotel's facilities, including a fitness center and meeting rooms, met the basic needs of a business traveler like myself.

The staff members I encountered during my stay were courteous and helpful, providing assistance when needed. However, there were moments when service could have been more prompt, and a bit more attention to detail in certain areas would enhance the overall guest experience.

In summary, Hotel City Centaur offers a reliable and convenient stay, especially for those looking for a centrally located accommodation with functional amenities. While it may not boast luxury, it fulfills the essential requirements for a comfortable stay at a reasonable price. I would consider returning for future visits to the city.

text.text: Stayed at goSTOPS Bengaluru in Gandhi Nagar (Majestic) and had a pleasant experience overall. The location is perfect—just a short walk from the bus and railway stations, making travel super convenient. The hostel has a colorful, vibrant vibe with common areas to relax and meet fellow travelers. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are decent for the price, though cleanliness could be improved a bit and ventilation in bathrooms needs attention. Great value for budget travellers and backpackers who want to stay in the heart of the city.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Octave Studio Hotel and found the location to be excellent very convenient and well-connected. The staff were polite and helpful, which added to the overall pleasant experience.

However, there were a few issues that need attention. The AC remote in the room was not functioning properly, making it difficult to adjust the temperature. The water pressure in the washroom was quite low, which was inconvenient. Additionally, the curtains were too small to fully cover the windows, compromising privacy. The pillow provided was quite worn and untidy, and the linens could use a more frequent change to maintain hygiene standards.

That said, the hotel has good potential with a few improvements in maintenance and amenities. With some attention to these details, it could offer a much more comfortable stay.

text.text: We stayed at Octave Studio Hotel near Koramangala and booked a studio room with a small kitchen space — simple, neat, and comfortable. What truly stood out was their exceptional customer service. The receptionist, Baskar, was incredibly helpful and welcoming. When we missed our train, he kindly arranged an extension for our stay at a very reasonable rate, without any hassle. Since we needed to use the kitchen, he made sure everything was set up and ready for us. His kindness and professionalism made our stay so much easier and more pleasant. Highly recommend this place — and a big thank you to Baskar for going above and beyond!

text.text:
Oh, where do I even start. I booked a room here on booking.com after seeing pictures - didn't read reviews properly (my bad). Originally booked a room for 5 nights but I just couldn't stay beyond one night. Couldn't even use the bathrooms.

The property's pics are very misleading on booking.com and on Google Reviews as well. Bathrooms were unclean, bed had hairs, sheets had stains, the door mat in the bathroom hasn't been changed in years. The shelves were dirty and there were small insects almost everywhere in the room.

They didn't agree to refund to me and I took this up with Booking.com and they offered some credits. Effectively, I did lose around 7.5k INR on this reservation.

The location is prime - lots of companies around the area and they can definitely do better in providing better service to customers but they're intentionally misleading with pictures from 9 years go! The place is no where close to what it is in the pictures.

text.text:
Very Disappointing Experience – Unfair Cancellation Policy

I booked this hotel for 7 nights through MakeMyTrip and paid the full amount in advance. Unfortunately, after staying for just 2 nights, I had to return to my hometown due to a medical emergency. Despite explaining the situation, the hotel staff refused to allow a partial cancellation or offer any refund for the unused nights.

Their lack of flexibility and empathy during a genuine emergency was extremely disappointing. Not a single rupee was returned. I expected better customer service, especially during such situations.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for fair and supportive service. Think twice before booking if your plans might change unexpectedly.

Stayed 4 days though booked for 1 day initially as we often shift if there is any bad experience. Cleaning was really appreciable compared to other hotels near by where in I stayed during my last visit a month ago. Factors I liked are,
*Clean washroom
*24x7 hot water shower just a tap away.
*Economical as price was 1400 per day.
*Location as Mantri mall is 5 mins walk.
*Staff behaviour was great.
*Cleaning was taken care carefully.
*Mineral water for drinking was kept just outside the door for drinking which was missing in my previous stays.
Thank you.

text.text:
For a daily rate of Rs500/- a day of 24 hrs for a single room this hotel ( with lift) which has an in-house restaurant is the best, close to central bus station, Main Railway station ,Metro station & is ideal safe for family stays. But the following things need to be rectified urgently to take it 4 star ratings.

1. All the floor tiles & bath room tiles need an acid wash immediately to make them sparkling. Then periodic sparkling is a must. This acid cleaning shall include corridors also..

2.They have to alter the plumbing to get hot water in the shower. This alteration will save them big on consumption of overall water by the entire lodge & will result in big savings.( profits) . My room shower & it's valve were broken. So using buckets I had to bathe. Till the time it happens administration has to arrange for the daily visit of a plumber.

3. All electric switches shud be cleaned sparkling white & then maintained like that.

4. In my room there were gaps in washroom glasses. Some were broken. In such a case women wudnot like to bath there.

5. The in-house vegetarian restaurant is open from 7 am to 2145 hrs. But the washroom & toilets of the restaurant on ground floor needs immediate acid cleaning to make all it's tilings & Flooring sparkling white. Presently it is looking dirty.

6. This lodge has an old building ( without lift) which is shut down now. This can be renovated quickly & peat control done & offered for budget travellers @ rs 250/- day Or so that wud fetch them big additional income.

All the above suggestions don't cost much at all but will enable get 5 star ratings for the lodge. In the given price & ambience there is no other hotel around with similar ambience so much centrally located in Bangalore heart for a middle class budget traveller. Four wheelers & two wheeler parking is available.

Excellent Service and Comfortable Stay!

I had a wonderful experience at this motel. The staff was incredibly friendly, welcoming, and always ready to help with anything I needed. Check-in was smooth and quick, and my room was clean, well-maintained, and cozy. The housekeeping team did a great job throughout my stay.

What stood out the most was the excellent customer service—every staff member I interacted with went above and beyond to ensure I had a pleasant stay. It’s clear they care about their guests.

Great value for the price, peaceful environment, and conveniently located. I’d definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a comfortable and hassle-free stay. Will definitely return!

text.text:
Octave Hotel & Spa in Kadubesanahalli offers an average room experience, making it a reasonable option if you’re looking for a short, affordable stay. The location is quite convenient, especially if you have business in the area or are looking to explore nearby attractions.

However, the room quality leaves something to be desired. The rooms themselves are just average and not very clean. I noticed stains on the bed sheets, which was quite off-putting, and the bathrooms were not well-maintained either. The bucket provided was dirty, which added to the overall feeling of lack of cleanliness.

On a positive note, the air conditioning worked well, which was a relief given the hot weather. The service was okay—nothing exceptional but not terrible either. The staff were helpful to a certain extent, but the general upkeep of the hotel needs improvement.

if you are looking for a budget-friendly place to stay for a short period, Octave Hotel & Spa might work for you. Just be prepared for an average experience and set your expectations accordingly.
